titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Water Street Associates collection on the Fulton Ferry Landing proposal 1990.027
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:28 +0000.

did.unittitle: Water Street Associates collection on the Fulton Ferry Landing proposal

physdesc.extent: in one tube box and one oversize folder

did.abstract: This collection contains reproductions of architectural renderings, elevations, and plans created by the firm Water Street Associates for its proposal for the renewal of the Fulton Ferry Landing neighborhood in Brooklyn, N.Y. Materials date from 1971.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1990.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
Drawings flattened and rehoused by John Zarrillo, March 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Water Street Associates collection on the Fulton Ferry Landing proposal, 1990.027, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
